trans-unit.source: Provides a set of values that describes how the dispatcher responds to failures that are encountered while requesting processing.
The Windows Presentation Foundation dispatcher reacts to failures that it encounters when requesting processing by setting a timer or posting messages to itself.
trans-unit.target: El distribuidor de Windows Presentation Foundation responde a los errores que encuentre al solicitar procesamiento estableciendo un temporizador o mensajes de registro a sí mismo.

trans-unit.source: These operations can fail if the underlying operating system resources are exhausted, which causes the dispatcher to become unresponsive.
trans-unit.target: Estas operaciones pueden producir un error si se agotan los recursos del sistema operativo subyacente, lo que hace que el distribuidor deje de responder.

trans-unit.source: A <xref:System.Windows.BaseCompatibilityPreferences.HandleDispatcherRequestProcessingFailureOptions> enumeration value can be assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.BaseCompatibilityPreferences.HandleDispatcherRequestProcessingFailure%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to aid in diagnosing the cause of this unresponsiveness.
trans-unit.target: A <xref:System.Windows.BaseCompatibilityPreferences.HandleDispatcherRequestProcessingFailureOptions> valor de enumeración puede asignarse a la <xref:System.Windows.BaseCompatibilityPreferences.HandleDispatcherRequestProcessingFailure%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> propiedad para ayudar a diagnosticar la causa de esta falta de respuesta.

trans-unit.source: It defines the behavior of the Windows Presentation Foundation dispatcher prior to the .NET Framework 4.7.1.
The dispatcher may become unresponsive when this option is selected.
Reset the dispatcher's state to try another request the next time one is needed.
While this option can sometimes "repair" unresponsiveness, it cannot honor the usual timing of processing, which can be crucial.
Selecting this option can lead to unexpected behavior.
This option immediately brings the problem to the application developer's attention.
